intro: Cyrtandra geantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and streamside habitats. Cyrtandra geantha has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, bell-like blooms that attract native pollinators. It is considered a rare and endemic species, highlighting its ecological importance in Hawaii's unique flora.
